name: Disney Movies VR
description: Transport yourself into the wonderful world of Disney from your very own living room with Disney Movies VR. This app is a fully-immersive Disney experience where you can visit themed worlds, including Disney, Marvel, and Lucasfilm, and interact with some of your favorite characters in their natural environments.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 8/10 64-bit Processor: Intel i5-4590 equivalent or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Video Card NVIDIA GTX 970 / AMD R9 290 equivalent or greater Storage: 3 GB available space

reviews.review_text: This is an interesting attempt, But it just does not work. Normally the idea of 360 videos does not bother me when it comes to VR but there is only a total of maybe 6-7 videos, Some of them literally just being commercials for upcoming Disney movies. And on top of that the resolution on these things is pretty low because 360 camera technology just isnt super great yet, This would have been a much better experiance if Disney would have invested some time into it and actually made some 3d in engine immersive environments to just stand around in.  The worst part of this is, Once you install the application, It literally wants you to individually download each 360 video which takes longer to download than it really should. Installed it , Tried 2 videos, Uninstalled.

This is the kind of experience that will give VR a bad name. Not worth the time to download. Unbelievable that an enterprise as wealthy as Disney can't publish something better than this as their introduction to VR. It looks like they gave an unpaid intern 2 weeks to put this together.
If you want to watch movies then do it on a better sorce than grainy VR. We are going backwards here folks.

This is a nice start for Disney in VR and I did enjoy the experiences. The VR Jungle Book experience with the snake was the best, but my runner up would be the BB-8 sequence of 360 movies. Hopefully we will see this program expanded in the future.
It's free and the rendered stuff is pretty cool, so I'd recommend just for that.  360째 videos are rubbish, as usual. No surprise there.  More rendered content please.
i didnt like the idea to download videos to begin and most of the videos were really laggy and at lease from my end blury   some of the disney ones make me really sick

Crashes on startup. Haven't had a single Vive game crash on me so not sure what the issue is but it seems poorly optimized. Shame coming from such a big company as I would love to see more Disney VR stuff.
Love the tree scene which is my favourite, you cannot go wrong with free.

The experience is not a finished product. Chaperone disappears so I have smashed my wardrobe well. Head pointing is silly as the same could be done with a controller. Framerate is inconsistent, I think it is a first time I felt a bit weird in this game when I was moving the head and the screen did not follow accurately. Valve, please remove this product till the issues are resolved.
need more real time rendered content than 360 videos. the kaa experience is pretty good

Reviewed using the HTC Vive  So this is free, therefore it's lack of content is not a huge negative! So far I've downloaded a number of the 'experiences' and, as expected, enjoyed some more than others. It's really a showcase for Disney's initial venture into VR and not much else - no games to play and not interactive as such, but with VR I suppose everything is interactive...?!   The Star Wars experiences are ok but nothing special, and I'm a fairly big fan. Haven't looked at the (single) Marvel experience yet as it's a red carpet video which doesn't interest me particularly.   Should you get it? Well yes, in my opinion. The Jungle Book experience with the snake is absolutely amazing. It is, however, only for the brave! If Disney can produce more content of that calibre then I will be happy to pay for content.

The best parts of this experience are:     The main menu, a nicely animated theme park, containing three sections: Disney, Avengers and Star Wars    The King Louie scene from the Jungle Book, looking up into that apes face, then meeting Baloo    Scene with Kaa. Creepy, try it yourself before you show it to your kid    A race over the surface of Jakku.   Everything below this line was completely underwhelming. I wouldn't bother downloading it.    A 360째 interview with some members of the cast of Jungle Book    Spy on Jakku: 8 short scenes showing the planet. Just 360 Videos    360째 video of the Avengers premiere    360째 video of the Jungle Book premiere  Who watches red carpet videos?

Bad enough that, despite it including STAR WARS and being FREE, I'm giving it a negative review? Yeah.  There are a few 'scenes' to jump into -- blurry, dodgy, 3D video that wasn't built for VR and wants to make me throw up. That's it, that's the whole app.  If you want to download and install it, I recommend just standing at the menu screen. That's the only part that's really built for VR. But you're just standing there.
